meanings.definition: A person who follows rules or commands.
meanings.sent1: The obeyer always listens to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The obeyer in the group never breaks the rules.
meanings.sent3: The obeyer at the office even follows the 'no eating at the desk' rule.
meanings.sent4: She was the obeyer of fashion trends, always wearing the latest styles.
meanings.sent5: The obeyer of traffic laws never exceeds the speed limit.

meanings.definition: To comply with orders or instructions.
meanings.sent1: He will obeyer the coach's game plan.
meanings.sent2: She obeyered the safety regulations without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to obeyer when told not to jump on the table.
meanings.sent4: The plants obeyered the sunlight, growing towards it each day.
meanings.sent5: The students obeyered the teacher's request to work quietly.
